title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel of the Jazz Age, telling the story of the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and repressive regimentation.

title: Python Crash Course
author: Eric Matthes
description: A hands-on, project-based introduction to programming for those interested in learning Python. Perfect for beginners.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A magical story about Santiago, an Andalusian shepherd boy who yearns to travel in search of a worldly treasure.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: Even bad code can function. But if code isn't clean, it can bring a development organization to its knees. A must-read for developers.

title: Harry Potter
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry Potter, an orphan, discovers he is a wizard and enrolls in the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The future of civilization rests in the fate of the One Ring, which has been lost for centuries. A powerful epic of good versus evil.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch in the American South.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A murder in the Louvre and clues in Da Vinci paintings lead to the discovery of a religious mystery protected by a secret society.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: The major New York Times bestseller that explains the two systems that drive the way we think: System 1 (fast) and System 2 (slow).

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: From a renowned historian comes a groundbreaking narrative of humanityâ€™s creation and evolutionâ€”a #1 international bestseller.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving--every day. Learn how to form good habits and break bad ones.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt
description: One of the most significant books on software development, covering philosophy, approach, and techniques for keeping code flexible and easy to adapt.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, Dune is the story of the boy Paul Atreides, heir to a noble family tasked with ruling an inhospitable world where the only thing of value is the 'spice' melange.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert Kiyosaki
description: It advocates the importance of financial literacy, financial independence and building wealth through investing in assets.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The timeless classic about Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel of manners that follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The exclusive biography of Steve Jobs, based on forty interviews with Jobs conducted over two years, as well as interviews with family and colleagues.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City who is expelled from his prep school and explores the city while dealing with alienation.

title: Zero to One
author: Peter Thiel
description: Notes on Startups, or How to Build the Future. A book on entrepreneurship and what it takes to build a successful startup.
